info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 17 at 9:49PM CDT until August 18 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Kansas, including the following county, Rooks.
* WHEN...Until midnight CDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rainfall from earlier in the evening had since ended. However, minor flooding likely continues within the Advisory area due to a widespread 2.50 to 3.50 inches of rain that fell mainly between 630 and 830 PM CDT. Any continued flooding is most likely impacting low-lying areas and possibly rural roads from near to several miles south of Webster State Park. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Sand Creek, Lost Creek, South Fork Solomon River, Ash Creek, Webster Reservoir Area. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Webster State Park, but especially rural areas near to several miles south the park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT
